Biar Nggak Tertipu! Baca Nih Modus Money Game Berkedok Investasi
07 Nov 2019, 06:38 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Foto: Ketua Satgas Waspada Investasi, Tongam L Tobing /Foto: Angling Adhitya

Jakarta - Kasus investasi bodong kembali mencuat. Kali ini Qnet yang terindikasi melakukan penipuan berkedok investasi dengan menjalankan skema multilevel marketing.Berkaca pada peristiwa itu, Ketua Satgas Waspada Investasi Tongam L Tobing menjelaskan skema money game yang biasa digunakan dalam investasi bodong biasanya menawarkan keuntungan yang sangat tinggi."Mereka itu selalu menawarkan keuntungan yang tinggi tapi waktunya cepat dan tanpa risiko," kata Tongam kepada detikcom di Jakarta Kamis (7/11/2019).Dia mengungkapkan, kegiatan money game ini bahkan bisa menawarkan bunga 1%-7% setiap harinya. "Mana ada investasi untungnya per hari bisa 7%," jelas Tongam. Menurut Tongam, underlying transaksi biasanya seperti perdagangan forex, cryptocurrency asset. Hingga investasi uang yang kegiatannya tidak ada.Tongam menjelaskan misalnya kasus Qnet yang menjual produk dengan harga berlebihan. Ini sudah mengindikasikan penggunaan skema piramida atau money game. "Fungsi penjualan produk itu sebagai kedok bisnis. Lalu ada juga bonus aktif yang diperoleh dari perekrutan atau member get member baru dapat bonus," ujarnya.Lalu bonus pasif dalam money game diperoleh berdasarkan persentase nilai investasi yang ditanamkan. Kemudian bonus keuntungan memang tidak masuk akal ada harian, hingga mingguan 20%. "Perusahaan biasanya mengizinkan member untuk memiliki lebih dari satu akun jadi bisa bergabung berkali-kali," jelas dia.Simak Video "Tergiur Untung Besar, Banyak Warga Babel Tertipu Bitcoin"[Gambas:Video 20detik](kil/hns)

Let me not be fooled! Read Here The Investment Game Under the guise of Investment
Nov 7, 2019, 06:38 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo: Chairman of the Investment Alert Task Force, Tongam L Tobing / Photo: Angling Adhitya

Jakarta - The case of bulging investment is sticking out again. This time, Qnet is indicated to commit fraud under the guise of investment by running a multilevel marketing scheme. Referring to the incident, Chairman of the Alert Investment Task Force Tongam L Tobing explained that the money game scheme used in bulging investments usually offers very high returns. "They always offer benefits high but the time is fast and without risk, "Tongam told AFP in Jakarta on Thursday (11/07/2019). He revealed that this money game activity could even offer interest of 1% -7% every day. "Where there is an investment fortunately per day can be 7%," explained Tongam. According to Tongam, underlying transactions are usually like forex trading, cryptocurrency assets. Until the investment of money whose activities are not there. Tongam explained for example the case of Qnet selling products at excessive prices. This has indicated the use of pyramid schemes or money games. "The function of selling the product is as a business guise. Then there is also an active bonus obtained from the recruitment or new member get member get a bonus," he said. Then the passive bonus in money games is obtained based on the percentage of investment value invested. Then the profit bonus does not make sense there are daily, up to 20% weekly. "Companies usually allow members to have more than one account so they can join many times," he explained.
